weighted_requirements.requirement: Shadow VP of Edge AI and capture friction points in real time
weighted_requirements.evidence_needed: Executive collaboration experience with workflow optimization

weighted_requirements.requirement: Ship daily GenAI agents and micro-automations
weighted_requirements.evidence_needed: Track record of daily shipping and rapid prototyping

weighted_requirements.requirement: Build VP's digital twin brain with 70%+ Turing test confusion
weighted_requirements.evidence_needed: AI personalization and voice synthesis expertise

weighted_requirements.requirement: Mastery of GenAI frameworks (LangChain, MCP, OpenAI, Claude)
weighted_requirements.evidence_needed: Portfolio of GenAI products built with these frameworks

weighted_requirements.requirement: Cut VP manual touchpoints by >25% within 60 days

hidden_insights.insight: Executive workflow reverse-engineering requires deep business acumen beyond technical skills
hidden_insights.why_hidden: Most applicants focus on technical GenAI skills, missing the strategic business context understanding required for VP-level automation

hidden_insights.insight: Real-time friction detection demands pattern recognition at executive decision-making level
hidden_insights.why_hidden: Requires understanding of executive mental models and decision patterns, not just process automation

hidden_insights.insight: Digital twin development needs specialized AI personalization beyond standard LLM fine-tuning
hidden_insights.why_hidden: Most candidates think digital twin = chatbot, missing the sophisticated voice modeling and decision pattern replication required

hidden_insights.insight: AI evangelism requires thought leadership communication skills and media presence ability
hidden_insights.why_hidden: Technical candidates often overlook the public-facing evangelism and external communication requirements

hidden_insights.insight: Enterprise security consciousness essential for VP-level data and communication access
hidden_insights.why_hidden: Candidates focus on functionality without considering enterprise security implications of VP-level automation

success_metrics: ≥ 30% reduction in VP calendar load by day 90
≥ 2 external media features or conference demos by month 6
≥ 70% confusion rate in digital twin Turing evaluation
>25% reduction in human touchpoints by day 60
failure_indicators: Inability to ship agents on daily basis
VP productivity not measurably improved by day 90
Digital twin fails Turing evaluation (<70% confusion)
No external media coverage by month 6
Cost per automation exceeds VP time value
technical_stack: AI/ML Frameworks: LangChain, MCP, OpenAI, Claude, Anthropic
Enterprise APIs: Teams, Confluence, Office, SharePoint
strategic_context: This role sits at the intersection of AI innovation and executive productivity transformation. ADI ($9B revenue, 24K employees) is positioning for competitive advantage through executive-level AI automation. The digital twin initiative represents a strategic bet on AI-first leadership workflows that could multiply across the entire organization. Success here creates a template for enterprise-wide executive augmentation.
